title: See the wonders of two newfound deep-sea coral reefs off the Galápagos
description: Coral reefs around the world are in trouble. But these reefs in the Galápagos Island Marine Reserve have yet to be damaged by humans.

title: Human cancer cells might slurp up bacteria-killing viruses for energy
description: In the lab, human cancer cells show signs of cell growth after ingesting bacteria-killing viruses, a hint our cells might use bacteriophages as fuel.

title: Surprisingly long-lived wild female chimps go through menopause
description: Chimpanzees in Uganda are the first known example of wild, nonhuman primates experiencing the hormonal changes, raising questions about how menopause evolved.

title: How quantum ‘squeezing’ will help LIGO detect more gravitational waves
description: An upgrade to LIGO that comes from exploiting a quantum rule known as the Heisenberg uncertainty principle makes it easier to detect spacetime ripples.
